intro: Campanula cochleariifolia subf. grandiflorens, commonly known as the large-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage that resembles a rosette. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, typically blooming in summer. These flowers are borne on tall, branching stems and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
